title: How to Write a Hamburger Paragraph
steps: Write a topic sentence as the "top bun" of your hamburger.
Add a detail as your tomato.
Layer on another detail as the cheese.
Add another sentence as your burger.
Add the lettuce, another detail that connects with the topic sentence.
Offer up the onions.
Finish up with the bottom bun.
Analyse your finished paragraph.
Review it again and consider any possible improvements.My friend Allie is really great, always there for me when I need her, no matter what.

title: How to Make Burger Bites
steps: Defrost.
Prep bread.
Prep sauce.
Cook the meat.
Finish the meat.
Finish the bread.
Finish the meal.
Enjoy your burger bites!.

title: How to Cook a Cheeseburger
steps: Start with good meat.
Place the ground beef in a bowl.
Roughly chop the onion and garlic.
Add the egg yolk.
Mix it all together.
Create the burgers.
Arrange the burgers on a plate.
Choose your cooking method.
While the burgers are cooking, prepare the toppings:.
Cover each with the top half of its bun, and enjoy.

title: How to Grill Burgers
steps: Get creative with the meat.
Season the meat.
Go crazy with toppings.
Experiment with a variety of condiments.
Use wood chips in your charcoal grill.
Finished.

title: How to Keep Burgers Flat
steps: Warm vegetable oil over medium-high heat in a skillet or flat top.
Place the meat in your pan and smash it flat.
Season the burgers with salt and pepper if you wish.
Cook the burger for about 2 minutes until the bottom is brown.
Flip the patties over and season them with salt and pepper.
Cook the patties for another minute until they are brown all over.

title: How to Boil Corned Beef
steps: Make your corned beef into hash and get ready for some serious flavor.
Spice up your corned beef hash by making baked eggs in hash nests.
Get traditional by making a New England boiled dinner.
Make your corned beef into a pie.
Try something totally different by making Scotch eggs covered in corned beef.

title: How to Grill That Perfect Burger
steps: Start with fresh ground chuck.
Make sure the chuck has a fat content of at least 15 to 22 percent to ensure juiciness.
Chill the beef well before forming patties.
Season the meat with salt and pepper.
Make each patty by forming about half a pound of ground chuck into a tight ball about the size of a baseball.
Use a spatula or other straight-edged tool to "pull in" the sides of the patty so that they remain together and tight.
Form patties about 1/2- to 3/4-inch thick.
Build a hot fire in the grill.
Place the burgers on the grill over direct heat.
Check doneness by peeking inside a patty with a spatula, or use an instant-read food thermometer inserted into the center of the patty.
Serve on fresh buns with any toppings you prefer: cheese, tomatoes, lettuce, onion, pickles and condiments such as ketchup, mayonnaise or mustard.
Finished.

title: How to Make Corned Beef Hash
steps: Gather the ingredients.
Combine corned roast beef hash, onion , mayonnaise, salt and pepper in a bowl.
Lightly toast bread.
Spread the corned beef hash mixture on bread.

title: How to Grill a Burger on a Foreman Grill
steps: Choose frozen burger patties that are no more than 0.5 in (1.3 cm) thick.
Preheat the grill for 5 minutes.
Place 2-4 frozen patties on the lower grill plate.
Close the lid and cook the burgers for 4.5-6.5 minutes.
Remove the burgers and test the internal temperature for doneness.
Eat the burgers before the internal temperature falls below 140 °F (60 °C).

title: How to Cook Polenta
steps: Gather the ingredients.
Make the basic polenta recipe from Method 1.
Stir in the butter and cheese.
Stir in the milk, parsley and spices.
Place the polenta in a bowl and serve hot.
